column4: i cant mount my /media/cdrom1, would someone be so kind and check whats wrong on my /etc/fstab and mtab? http://pastebin.com/573889
I'll look
thanks :)
umount -l /dev/hdc and remount it
iok
let me know how it goes
it tells me this: mount: block device /dev/hdc is write-protected, mounting read-only
good. CDs are readonly.
okayz so what could i do?
you should be able to read the cd now
i cant. the cd is not mounted :(
damn
i noticed that that i have to very similar lines on fstab and mtab, maybe thats making the problem?
backup your mtab and delete the lines refering to the cdrom, this may break something so backup the mtab file
okay. how do i backup it. Just save the lines on mtab?
cp mtab mtab_backup
any luck?
not really, it says /media/cdrom1 is not mounted (according to mtab)
did you try mounting it?
yes. when i type sudo mount /media/cdrom1 or mount /dev/hdc it says: mount: block device /dev/hdc is write-protected, mounting read-only
I'm at the end of my knowledge... sorry
thanks anyway :)
your welcome.
